PARAM_DESCRIPTION.SP: : a matrix. Only its dimensions are taken into account.

DESCRIPTION.P: Without key argument the syntaxes below produce random matrices with the current random generator (default is "uniform")

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: rand(m1,m2)
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: is a random matrix of dimension m1 by m2.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: rand(m1,m2,..,mn)
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: is a random matrix of dimension m1 by m2,.. by mn.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: rand(a)
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: is a random matrix of same size as a. rand(a) is complex if a is a complex matrix

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: rand() : with no arguments gives a scalar whose value changes

DESCRIPTION.P: If present, the key argument allows to specifie an other random generator.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: rand('uniform')
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: The current random generator is set to a uniform random number generator. Random numbers are uniformly distributed in the interval (0,1).

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: rand('normal')
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: The current random generator is set to a Gaussian (with mean 0 and variance 1) random number generator .

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: str=rand('info')
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: return the type of the default random generator ('uniform' or 'normal')

DESCRIPTION.P: IT is possible to (re-)initialize the seed of the rand generator:

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: rand('seed')
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: returns the current value of the seed.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: rand('seed',n)
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: puts the seed to n. (n=0 at first call).
